goal.ch: “The course is to instruct students the advanced knowledge in the area of lipid biochemistry. In addition, the course would focus on the discussion. Also, the class students must present an oral report and a paper report after they read the literature relevant to the lipids.“
goal.en: “The course is to instruct students the advanced knowledge in the area of lipid biochemistry. In addition, the course would focus on the discussion. Also, the class students must present an oral report and a paper report after they read the literature relevant to the lipids.“

outline.ch:
“1st week: Introduction
2nd week: Lipid definition, lipid classification
3rd week: Classification and metabolism of fatty acids
4th week: Classification and metabolism of triacylglycerols
5th week: Classification and metabolism of phospholipids
6th week: Classification and metabolism of cholesterols and steroid hormones
7th week: Lipid: isolation, separation, and detection
8th week: Lipid ＆ development: Changes in total lipids and lipid classes during metamorphosis
9th week: Mid-term exam
10th week: Lipid metabolism ＆ development: Changes in lipid metabolism during metamorphosis
11th week: Fatty acid assay and fatty acid composition analysis
12th week: Lipid depot organ: Development of fat cells and obesity
13th week: Nutritional regulation: Green tea catechin regulation of fat cell functions
14th week: Hormone regulation: Regulation of fish lipid metabolism by insulin and somatostatin
15th week: Lipid metabolism in cancers I (e.g., prostate cancer and colon cancer)
16th week: Lipid metabolism in cancers II (e.g., prostate cancer and colon cancer) (oral report)
17th week: Adipokines (oral report)
18th week: White ＆ Brown Adipose Tissues (Final exam, oral report)“
outline.en:
“1st week: Introduction
2nd week: Lipid definition, lipid classification
3rd week: Classification and metabolism of fatty acids
4th week: Classification and metabolism of triacylglycerols
5th week: Classification and metabolism of phospholipids
6th week: Classification and metabolism of cholesterols and steroid hormones
7th week: Lipid: isolation, separation, and detection
8th week: Lipid ＆ development: Changes in total lipids and lipid classes during metamorphosis
9th week: Mid-term exam
10th week: Lipid metabolism ＆ development: Changes in lipid metabolism during metamorphosis
11th week: Fatty acid assay and fatty acid composition analysis
12th week: Lipid depot organ: Development of fat cells and obesity
13th week: Nutritional regulation: Green tea catechin regulation of fat cell functions
14th week: Hormone regulation: Regulation of fish lipid metabolism by insulin and somatostatin
15th week: Lipid metabolism in cancers I (e.g., prostate cancer and colon cancer)
16th week: Lipid metabolism in cancers II (e.g., prostate cancer and colon cancer) (oral report)
17th week: Adipokines (oral report)
18th week: White ＆ Brown Adipose Tissues (Final exam, oral report)“

textbook.ch:
“教科書: 1. Gurr MI, Harwood JL, Frayn KN. 2002. ““Lipid Biochemistry““. 5th edition. Blackwell Science Ltd. Osney
Mead, Oxford, UK. 2. Vance DE and Vance JE. 2008. ““Biochemistry of lipids, lipoproteins, and membranes““. 5th edition. Elsevier, The Netherlands.
Reference book: Gunstone FD. 2004. ““The chemistry of oils and fats““. Blackwell Science Ltd. Osney Mead, Oxford, UK
參考文獻: Lipids, J Biol Chem, J Lipid Res, Nature, Science, BBRC, BBA“
textbook.en:
“Textbook: 1. Gurr MI, Harwood JL, Frayn KN. 2002. ““Lipid Biochemistry““. 5th edition. Blackwell Science Ltd. Osney Mead, Oxford, UK. 2. Vance DE and Vance JE. 2008. ““Biochemistry of lipids, lipoproteins, and membranes““. 5th edition. Elsevier, The Netherlands.
Reference book: Gunstone FD. 2004. ““The chemistry of oils and fats““. Blackwell Science Ltd. Osney Mead, Oxford, UK
Reference Journals: Lipids, J Biol Chem, J Lipid Res, Nature, Science, BBRC, BBA“

gradMethod.ch:
“Course requirements:
question/appearance         20％
oral      40％
term paper           40％
total   100％“
gradMethod.en:
“Course requirements:
question/appearance         20％
oral            40％
term paper           40％
total   100％“

flexDiscription.ch: Two weeks due to exam will be modified with oral presentation and paper term report. The final two weeks will be kept for student to prepare the term reports. If students did not report and present the paper well, then the final two weeks can be used for their repeated presentation.
flexDiscription.en: Two weeks due to exam will be modified with oral presentation and paper term report. The final two weeks will be kept for student to prepare the term reports. If students did not report and present the paper well, then the final two weeks can be used for their repeated presentation.

ch: 系所:限生命科學系。年級:限三年級、四年級。
系所:限生命科學系碩士班、生命科學系博士班。
en: Department:Department of Life Sciences only.Year:Third Year、Fourth Year only.
Department:MSc in Life Science、PhD in Life Science only.
